thread.title: Nathaniel Rateliff has first Billboard No. 1
thread.title_full: Nathaniel Rateliff has first Billboard No. 1

title: Nathaniel Rateliff has first Billboard No. 1
text:
Nathaniel Rateliff has first Billboard No. 1 Well son of a … sailor. Post to Facebook Nathaniel Rateliff has first Billboard No. 1 Well son of a … sailor.  //on9news.tv/1LyEkUi   Join the Conversation To   Nathaniel Rateliff has first Billboard No. 1 Allison Sylte, 4:59 p.m. MDT October 16, 2015 Nathaniel Rateliff & the Night Sweats (Photo: Zach Hundley) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
KUSA – Well son of a … sailor. 
Local heroes Nathaniel Rateliff and the Night Sweats have their first No. 1 hit. Their single "S.O.B" is currently at the top of the Adult Alternative Songs airplay chart -- and that's despite (or because of) the fact that the chorus repeatedly involves the singer shouting a euphemism for "female dog" that we can't type on this family-friendly news site. 
According to Billboard, the song has gained 7 percent in plays at the format during the Oct. 24 tracking week, and 9 percent growth in digital sales, to 14,000. 
It has been streamed 761,000 times during this period – a 16 percent increase from the previous tracking period. 
Nathaniel Rateliff has been a staple in Colorado's music scene for years, but got the nation to catch on to him thanks to his newly soulful sound (and the Night Sweats, obviously). 
Now, somebody get me a ... chocolate milk, because I'm at work (like the lede, this is a not-so-clever reference to the song's lyrics). 
And while you're doing that, watch the video for "S.O.B" below:
